intro: Anthistiria linneana, commonly known as the Linnean anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are typically finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Anthistiria linneana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
